member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.AuxLevel
member.summary: Intensity Level of Auxiliary Lights

members.member:
About: Values
Off - The lights are off Dimmed - The lights are in a dimmed state Full - The lights are in full state
The Lights are off

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.AuxLevel.Dimmed
member.summary: The lights are in a dimmed state

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.AuxLevel.Full
member.summary: The lights are in full state

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Extension
member.summary: Some useful extensions

member.summary: Converts an uint to an given enum type

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Extension.ToEnum``1(System.String)
member.summary: Converts an string to an given enum type. If string conversion not work, give 0 as the given enum back

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Extension.StringFormater(System.String)
member.summary: A string formatter for an nested datatype

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry
member.summary: Telemetry Data of SCS SDK's

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.GamePlayEvents
member.summary: Gameplay Events that can be fired from the sdk (starting for game version 1.35+) first implementation is that the values will be set, but never deleted another change listener for bool values that will be changed will say if there are new values

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.MinutesToDate(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts uint minutes in a DateTime object
member.returns: DateTime object of the in-game time

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.MinutesToDate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts int minutes in a DateTime object
member.returns: DateTime object of the in-game time

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Add(SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.FVector,SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.FVector)
member.summary: Adds two float vectors

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Add(SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.DVector,SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.FVector)
member.summary: Adds float vector to double vector

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Rotate(SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Euler,SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.FVector)
member.summary: Rotates specified vector by specified orientation

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Common
member.summary: Telemetry specific channels which might be used by more than one game.

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Common.#ctor
member.summary: initialise a Common object

members.member:
About: Scale Games which use real 1:1 maps will not provide this channel
Scale applied to distance and time to compensate for the scale of the map(e.g. 1s of real time corresponds to local_scale minutes of simulated game time).
**INFORMATION**
Games which use real 1:1 maps will not provide this channel.
**INFORMATION**

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Common.GameTime
member.summary: Absolute in-game time.
member.example:
var GameTime = SCSTelemetry.Common.GameTime;
To handle the in-game time in minutes
var inGameMinutes = GameTime.Value; // Should be a uint
Don't want to convert it yourself
var inGameDate = GameTime.Date; // Should be a DateTime

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Common.NextRestStop
member.summary: Time until next rest stop.

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Common.NextRestStopTime
member.summary: In game time of next rest stop
member.example:
GameTime == 05.01.0001 12:15 // Pseudocode
Next time until rest stop (NextRestStop) 5:45
NextRestStopTime == 05.01.0001 18:00 // Pseudocode
Next time until rest stop (NextRestStop) -14:15
NextRestStopTime == 04.01.0001 22:00 // Pseudocode

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Control
member.summary: User Input value and value used by the game

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Control.#ctor
member.summary: Initialise a Control object

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Control.InputValues
member.summary: Contains the values of the user input

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Control.GameValues
member.summary: Cpntains the values the game use

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Control.Input
member.summary: Input value

members.member:
About: Steering Note that it is interpreted counterclockwise.
If the user presses the steer right button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to -1.0
About: Throttle If the user presses the forward button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to 1.0
About: Brake If the user presses the brake button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to 1.0
About: Clutch If the user presses the clutch button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to 1.0
Steering received from input <-1;1>.
**INFORMATION** Note that it is interpreted counterclockwise.
If the user presses the steer right button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to -1.0 **INFORMATION**

Throttle received from input <0;1>.
**INFORMATION** If the user presses the forward button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to 1.0 **INFORMATION**

Brake received from input <0;1>.
**INFORMATION** If the user presses the brake button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to 1.0 **INFORMATION**

Clutch received from input <0;1>.
**INFORMATION** If the user presses the clutch button on digital input (e.g. keyboard) this value goes immediatelly to 1.0 **INFORMATION**

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Control.Game
member.summary: value used by the game

members.member:
About: Steer Note that it is interpreted counterclockwise.
Accounts for interpolation speeds and simulated counterforces for digital inputs
About: Throttle Accounts for the press attack curve for digital inputs or cruise-control input.
About: Brake Accounts for the press attack curve for digital inputs. Does not contain retarder, parking or motor brake.
About: Clutch Accounts for the automatic shifting or interpolation of player input.
Steering as used by the simulation <-1;1>
**INFORMATION** Note that it is interpreted counterclockwise.
Accounts for interpolation speeds and simulated counterforces for digital inputs **INFORMATION** ///

Throttle pedal input as used by the simulation <0;1>.
**INFORMATION** Accounts for the press attack curve for digital inputs or cruise-control input. **INFORMATION**

Brake pedal input as used by the simulation <0;1>.
**INFORMATION** Accounts for the press attack curve for digital inputs. Does not contain retarder, parking or motor brake. **INFORMATION**

Clutch pedal input as used by the simulation <0;1>.
**INFORMATION** Accounts for the automatic shifting or interpolation of player input. **INFORMATION**

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.#ctor
member.summary: initialise an SCSTelemetry object

members.member:
About: Currency
- ATS use US Dollars as internal currency - ETS2 use Euro as internal currency
About: GameVersion Does *NOT* match the patch level of the game
About: Temperatures Aproximated for entire truck, not at the wheel level.
Is the sdk active (only reset when game is closed correct, crashes or kills won't set this value)

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Timestamp
member.summary: Timestamp not the in game time,

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Paused
member.summary: Is the game actual paused? (Menu, F1, Map, etc. open)
member.example:
Driving
Paused == true
Menu/Map
Paused == false

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Game
member.summary: Which game data we collect?
member.example:
Running game is EuroTruckSimulator2
Game == SCSGame.Ets2
Running game is AmericanTruckSimulator
Game == SCSGame.Ats

members.member:
Version of the game for purpose of the specific api which is being initialized.
**INFORMATION** Does NOT match the patch level of the game. **INFORMATION**

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.PositionData
member.summary: Position of the Cabin, head and hook

member.name: M:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.PositionData.#ctor
member.summary: Initialise a positionData object

members.member:
About: Cabin This is position of the joint around which the cabin rotates. This attribute might be not present if the vehicle does not have a separate cabin. About: HeadOffset Note that this value might change rapidly as result of the user switching between cameras or camera presets.
Position of the cabin in the vehicle space.
**INFORMATION** This is position of the joint around which the cabin rotates. This attribute might be not present if the vehicle does not have a separate cabin. **INFORMATION**

member.summary: Default position of the head in the cabin space

member.summary: Default position of the hook in vehicle space

member.summary: Represents a cabin space position and orientation delta of the driver head from its default position.

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Trailer.Wheels
member.summary: States of the Wheels

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Trailer.Wheels.SuspDeflection
member.summary: Vertical displacement of the wheel from its axis in meters

members.member:
Angular velocity of the wheel in rotations per second
**INFORMATION**
Positive velocity corresponds to forward movement
**INFORMATION**

Steering rotation of the wheel in rotations
**INFORMATION**
Value is from <0.25,0.25> range in counterclockwise direction when looking from top (e.g. 0.25 corresponds to left and -0.25 corresponds to right)
Set to zero for non-steered wheels
**INFORMATION**

Rolling rotation of the wheel in rotations
**INFORMATION**
Value is from <0.0,1.0) range in which value increase corresponds to forward movement
**INFORMATION**

member.summary: Is true if the wheel contacts the ground

members.member:
Selected gear displayed on dashboard
**INFORMATION** > 0 - Forward gears 0 - Neutral < 0 - Reverse gears **INFORMATION**

**INFORMATION** Uses negative value to represent reverse movement **INFORMATION**

Speed selected for the cruise control in m/s
**INFORMATION** Is zero if cruise control is disabled. **INFORMATION**

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Lights
member.summary: Lightlevel and state of Lights

members.member:
About: Blinker Avtive This represents the logical enable state of the blinker. It it is true as long the blinker is enabled regardless of the physical enabled state of the light (i.e. it does not blink and ignores enable state of electric).
Are the auxiliary front lights active?

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Lights.AuxRoof
member.summary: Are the auxiliary roof lights active?

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Lights.DashboardBacklight
member.summary: Intensity of the dashboard backlight as factor <0;1>

members.member:
Is the left blinker enabled?
**INFORMATION** This represents the logical enable state of the blinker. It it is true as long the blinker is enabled regardless of the physical enabled state of the light (i.e. it does not blink and ignores enable state of electric). **INFORMATION**

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Lights.BlinkerLeftOn
member.summary: Is the light in the left blinker currently on?

members.member:
Is the Right blinker enabled?
**INFORMATION** This represents the logical enable state of the blinker. It it is true as long the blinker is enabled regardless of the physical enabled state of the light (i.e. it does not blink and ignores enable state of electric). **INFORMATION**

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Lights.BlinkerRightOn
member.summary: Is the light in the Right blinker currently on?

member.summary: Are the parking lights enabled?

member.summary: Are the BeamLow lights enabled?

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Wheels
member.summary: States of the Wheels

member.name: P:SCSSdkClient.Object.SCSTelemetry.Truck.Current.Wheels.SuspDeflection
member.summary: Vertical displacement of the wheel from its axis in meters

members.member:
Angular velocity of the wheel in rotations per second
**INFORMATION** Positive velocity corresponds to forward movement **INFORMATION**

Steering rotation of the wheel in rotations
**INFORMATION** Value is from <0.25,0.25> range in counterclockwise direction when looking from top (e.g. 0.25 corresponds to left and -0.25 corresponds to right)
Set to zero for non-steered wheels **INFORMATION**

Rolling rotation of the wheel in rotations
**INFORMATION** Value is from <0.0,1.0) range in which value increase corresponds to forward movement **INFORMATION**

Lift state of the wheel <0;1>
**INFORMATION** For use with simple lifted/non-lifted test or logical visualization of the lifting progress.
Value of 0 corresponds to non-lifted axle. Value of 1 corresponds to fully lifted axle.
Set to zero or not provided for non-liftable axles. **INFORMATION**

Vertical displacement of the wheel axle from its normal position in meters as result of lifting.
**INFORMATION** Might have non-linear relation to lift ratio.
Set to zero or not provided for non-liftable axles. **INFORMATION**

member.summary: Is the wheel in contact with ground?

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.Offence
member.summary: Offence type

members.member:
About: Values
NoValue - No Value from the sdk Crash - Crash with another vehicle Avoid_sleeping - driver did not sleep Wrong_way - drive on the wrong side of the street Speeding_camera - drives to fast at a camera No_lights - drives without lights on Red_signal - ignores a red signal Avoid-Weighting - ignore weighting Speeding - drives to fast Illegal_trailer - carries a trailer that is not allowed in this area Generic - some other generic fine
No Value from the sdk

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Crash
member.summary: Crash with another vehicle

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Avoid_sleeping
member.summary: driver did not sleep

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Wrong_way
member.summary: drive on the wrong side of the street

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Speeding_camera
member.summary: drives to fast at a camera

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.No_lights
member.summary: drives without lights on

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Red_signal
member.summary: ignores a red signal

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Avoid_weighting
member.summary: ignore weighting

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Speeding
member.summary: drives to fast

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Illegal_trailer
member.summary: carries a trailer that is not allowed in this area

member.name: F:SCSSdkClient.Offence.Generic
member.summary: some other generic fine

member.name: T:SCSSdkClient.SCSGame
member.summary: Which game loaded the sdk?

members.member:
About: Values
Unknown - Unknown Game, most of the telemetry data won't work Ets2 - EuroTruckSimulator2 is running Ats - AmericanTruckSimulator is running
Unknown Game
